Name: Fitted mohair wool tuxedo
Description: A tuxedo crafted from mohair wool with contrasting satin details. Tailored in Gucci's fitted silhouette with a slim jacket and slightly cropped pants. Elements from classic tailoring continue to be reimagined through the Gucci lens.

Name: Fitted bee check wool suit
Description: The suit's notch lapel and soft, narrow shoulders point to its archival inspiration while its fit keeps it firmly rooted in the now. The bee—a symbol first used by Gucci in the '70s—is brought back into the forefront and established as a key code of the House.

Name: Tapered wool mohair tuxedo
Description: The House's slim-fitting suit is presented in a blend of black wool and mohair. Gucci continues to push the established notions of tailoring and enhance them with diverse fits, fabrics and codes.

Name: New Signoria bees wool gabardine suit
Description: The House's slim-fitting suit, the New Signoria, is presented in dark blue wool gabardine, enriched with a silk bees pattern. A distinctive symbol of the House – the bee comes from the '70s archives and is often associated with nobility, appearing in family crests, tapestries and paintings.

Name: Heritage tuxedo with piping
Description: A stretch twill tuxedo trimmed with red piping, inspired by the one worn by Jared Leto at the 2016 Oscars. Tailored in Gucci's Heritage fit with a slim jacket and slightly cropped pants..
